STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 12, 2023
Alison Anne Morrison
GRATIOT COUNTY DHHS
201 COMMERCE DR,
ITHACA, MI, 48847-1601
RE: License#: CP290201154
Dear Alison Anne Morrison:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/09/2023 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. A
corrective action plan for noncompliance with FOM 722-6B as a result of the
interim evaluation completed 8/30/2022 was received 9/12/2022 and approved
9/20/2022. There were no areas of identified noncompliance as a result of this
renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment

The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the corrective action
plan for the interim evaluation that involved one citation. The assessment also
involved a review of any disrupted placements and an assessment of the factors
associated with the disruption.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff were involved in both entrance and exit conferences. Staff
participation was positive, and no concerns were presented.
Analyst interviews with youth were positive and indicated appropriate support is
being provided by the caregivers and agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Building was well maintained and appropriate. Records were maintained
consistent with licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert involving a shelf above a crib in a relative home. The
safety alert was resolved 3/3/23 and approved 3/8/23. Photographic evidence
substantiated compliance.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
_____________________________________06/12/2023
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
